description: Ultra-low cost (up to 80% cheaper than AWS), free egress when paired with Cloudflare.
better than next auth. Full control in your code—no vendor lock-in. Plug in OAuth, email, or custom providers via simple adapter pattern.
Blazing-fast global CDN with ultra-low cost, flexible per-region pricing, and free SSL.
Cheap & fast geo-replicated storage that pairs perfectly with Bunny CDN.
Seamless image & file optimization plus end-to-end video streaming — built-in encoding, global delivery, usage-based pricing, and real-time resizing.
Auto HTTPS, easy config, and super developer-friendly — nice if you want a modern alternative to nginx without fiddling with certbot.
When Postgres gets slow for big aggregates, ClickHouse eats huge logs for breakfast. SQL, columnar, crazy fast — but needs care when writing.
Unified gateway for managing and observing calls to AI APIs — adds caching, rate limiting, logging, and cost control for any AI provider.
Massive global network, free tier, DDoS protection, and automatic caching — best all-round CDN for performance + security.
Run any containerized app on Cloudflare’s global edge with tight Workers integration, on-demand scaling, and globally routable Durable Objects — serverless, stateful, and cost-effective.
Zero egress fees by default, S3-compatible API, and built-in Cloudflare edge network for faster global delivery.
Hassle-free video hosting and streaming with global delivery, usage-based billing, and built-in player.
Expose local dev servers or self-hosted apps securely without fiddling with firewall or NAT — TLS and auth baked in. Dead simple if you’re already on Cloudflare.
Serverless vector database built right into the Cloudflare edge — store, index, and search embeddings globally with zero infrastructure headaches.
Virtual waiting room to manage peak traffic, balance load, and prevent server overload.
Run serverless code at the edge with zero cold starts — powerful for APIs, redirects, or custom logic.
Run 50+ open-source models on serverless GPUs, globally distributed. Zero infrastructure to manage — fully integrated with Workers, Pages & AI Gateway.
Private, ad-free, zero-log downloader for dozens of sites — works locally or self-hosted, with encrypted tunnels for maximum privacy.
Built-in realtime data syncing + auth in one SDK. No separate GraphQL or REST layers—just call JS/TS functions that magically keep clients in sync.
Self-hosted Heroku — spin up apps, DBs, cron, and deploy from Git with no vendor lock. Good if you want full control but Heroku simplicity.
Open source Headless browser scraping with smart anti-bot handling baked in. Good middle ground between DIY Puppeteer scripts and big scraping SaaS.
Modern alternative to Airflow — better DX for building pipelines with Python. Good observability and solid for local dev.
The classic “just works” VPS. Dead-simple UI, tons of tutorials — perfect for quick side projects when you don’t want to fiddle too much.
Sane Python framework for building robust data pipelines — perfect for ELT with modern data stacks. Way less boilerplate than hand-rolled scripts.
Straightforward, self-hostable e-sign tool — good alternative if you want to skip pricey SaaS and keep documents private.
Just run heavy analytical SQL right in your script — no infra needed. Like having a mini-data warehouse in your Python notebook.
If you like TypeScript but want Haskell-style effects and dependency injection, Effect is a no-brainer. Handles async, errors, and resources like a real FP runtime.
Similar to Airbyte but fully managed — rock-solid syncs for when you don’t want to babysit pipelines. Costs add up fast though.
Lets you run real containers close to users, not just serverless functions. LiteFS for SQLite replication at the edge is genuinely unique.
Reliable EU-based servers with unbeatable price-to-performance, generous bandwidth, and transparent pricing.
Affordable, high-capacity storage with unlimited traffic, easy protocols (SFTP, SMB, WebDAV), and EU data privacy.
Handles retries, delays, and workflows that normally need a ton of cron + queue glue. Local dev experience is great — feels like writing normal server code.
Instant screen recording with console logs, network requests, and repro steps auto-attached — devs get exactly what they need to fix bugs fast.
Global serverless platform for running Docker containers and web services and ai models
Straightforward learning hub to master SPF, DKIM, and DMARC — solid if you’re setting up secure email and want to avoid the usual trial and error.
Solid, no-frills VPS. They’ve been around forever and now get Akamai’s global network perks. Good if you want predictable performance with no drama.
Add Google Docs–style multiplayer to your app with dead simple APIs for presence, live cursors, and CRDT-backed storage.

A full-fledged TypeScript framework for building, observing, and deploying AI agents and workflows. From practical experience, it’s saved me hours wiring up RAG, tool-calling, memory, tracing, and playback—all integrated and type-safe (no messy glue code between SDKs)
EU-hosted tool for testing and monitoring your email authentication (SPF, DKIM, DMARC). Good for catching misconfigs that wreck deliverability or compliance.
Easiest self-hosted BI tool — connects to your DB, point and click charts for non-technical folks. Great if you’re tired of making dashboards in Google Sheets.
S3-compatible storage you can run anywhere — local dev, on-prem, or cloud. Great when you want S3 features but don’t want S3 bills.
Easiest way to run GPU-heavy Python without wrangling CUDA or Docker. Feels like writing local code that scales to big machines when needed.
If you outgrow local DuckDB files, MotherDuck makes it trivial to scale up to the cloud but keep the same workflow. Hybrid local+cloud is the key angle.
Developer-friendly video platform for streaming, live, and on-demand video — APIs, analytics, and beautiful playback with pay-as-you-go pricing.
Turn any SQL DB into a spreadsheet-like interface. Good for letting non-devs poke at data without writing SQL or spinning up Airtable.
Notion-inspired editor with built-in AI autocompletion—means I get smart suggestions without context-switching to ChatGPT. Feels native, fast, and avoids fiddling with separate tooling.
Cost-effective EU-focused CDN with tight integration for OVH hosting and pay-as-you-go pricing.
High-performance VPS with unmetered bandwidth (except Asia-Pacific) at very competitive prices.
Swiss army knife for converting anything text-ish to anything else — Markdown to PDF, DOCX to HTML, you name it. CLI is legendary once you get the flags right.
Schema changes never block production — database branching is the real standout here. Great if you hate late-night “oops, migration locked the app” moments.
Tiny Go backend you can run anywhere — gives you auth, real-time DB, file storage, and an admin UI in a single binary. Ridiculously easy for side projects or POCs.
Easiest way to manage Docker containers via a web UI. Great when you’re self-hosting lots of stuff and don’t want to SSH for every little tweak.
Full-stack, open-source analytics you can self-host. Heatmaps + feature flags in one dashboard—no “black box” data hoarding.
Write your infra in real programming languages (TS/Python/Go/C#) instead of YAML. Native loops, abstractions, and testing feel like real code.
If you just want WebSockets working now with zero infra, Pusher is still the easiest plug-and-play for channels and events.
Basically “Heroku, but modern”. Git push, deploy, done. Usage-based billing is great if you don’t want to idle infra burning cash.
Spotlight on steroids for devs — extensions for GitHub, Jira, scripts, clipboard manager, all in one launcher. You’ll never open your browser for tiny tasks again.
Best way to actually see what broke — traces, breadcrumbs, and releases make debugging less guesswork.
Search engine for internet-connected devices — find exposed servers, IoT, or vulnerabilities instantly.
Combines CDK for infra with live Lambda development. Edit your Lambda code locally and see changes instantly—no rebuilds or redeploys.Ask ChatGPT
Instant Postgres with realtime, row-level security, auth, and auto-generated APIs. Postgres fanatics finally get a Firebase alternative.
Zero-config mesh VPN — connect all your servers, VMs, and dev machines like they’re on the same LAN. Magic DNS and easy ACLs are a lifesaver.
Makes complex workflows dead-simple — retries, timeouts, long-running tasks, all handled for you. Feels weird at first but saves you from spaghetti cron jobs + DB flags
A ProseMirror-based, headless TS editor with full control over UI and extensions. I've built custom editors and it’s flexible and reliable—no vendor lock-in, and docs/community are solid.
Similar to Inngest but fully open source and really tight with TypeScript/Next.js. Good if you want background jobs baked right into your app repo.
SQLite with global edge replicas — so you can do low-latency reads basically anywhere. Pairs well with edge runtimes like Workers or Fly.
If you want Algolia-level speed but truly open source and easy to self-host. Good docs, very community-friendly.
Turn PDFs, DOCX, and messy HTML into clean text chunks for LLMs — saves tons of regex hacking when building RAG pipelines.
Serverless Redis or Kafka with usage-based pricing — dead simple to plug into serverless or edge runtimes where you can’t run stateful infra. Good for queues or rate limits.
Easy to find a location really close to users — more city-level data centers than most. Their High-Frequency compute is a great bang-for-buck if you need snappy CPUs.
Turn HTML + CSS into PDFs with great control over styling. Solid if you need pixel-perfect invoices or reports without fighting headless Chrome.
Handles multi-tenancy out of the box — one of the easiest vector DBs if you need isolated spaces for each customer without gluing together your own auth layer.
Lets you bolt on enterprise SSO, directory sync, and audit logs in minutes—no wrestling with SAML/OIDC specs. All your user-management headaches handled via a simple REST/SDK interface
